description: System-generated unique identifier for this time entry record.
High-precision system timestamp when the time entry was created or last updated; used for audit ordering.
End time of the worked period (HHMMSS), paired with edate to form the stop datetime.
Start time of the worked period (HHMMSS), paired with sdate to form the start datetime.
Calendar date when the work ended (YYYYMMDD), used with etime.
Calendar date when the work began (YYYYMMDD), used with stime.
Free-text notes describing the work or context for this time entry.
Total duration of work recorded for this entry expressed in decimal hours.
Identifier linking this time entry to the associated work order labor record.
Likely indicates the reference key/type used to link to the work order labor record; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the corresponding entry in the legacy system for migration traceability.
Name of the source table in the legacy system from which this record originated.
Likely the minute component of the start time derived from stime; confirm with SME.
Likely the hour component of the start time derived from stime; confirm with SME.
Classification of the time record (e.g., clocked vs manual hours); values may indicate how time was captured.
Human-readable duration for this entry in HH:MM format, derived from recorded hours.
Manually entered additional time to adjust or supplement clocked time, in decimal hours.
Minutes component of time captured via time clock for this entry.
Hours component of time captured via time clock for this entry.
Flag indicating whether the work associated with this time entry has been completed.
Decimal-hours total after applying adjustments or conversions; likely the normalized value used for billing or reporting; confirm with SME.
